question.title: What are the main clinical signs associated with hypocalcaemia?

option_a.title: Neuromuscular disorders mainly: distal paraesthesias, muscle cramps, and tetany

option_b.title: Neuromuscular disorders mainly: laryngeal spasms, seizures, Chvostek's and Trousseau's provoked signs

option_c.title: Neuromuscular disorders mainly: distal paraesthesias, muscle cramps, and tetany, which are correlated with the depth of hypocalcaemia and the speed with which it develops

option_d.title: Neuromuscular disorders mainly: laryngeal spasms, seizures, Chvostek's and Trousseau's provoked signs, which are correlated with the depth of hypocalcaemia and the speed with which it develops
